about.summary: Solves multivariate least squares (MLS) problems subject to constraints on the coefficients, e.g., non-negativity, orthogonality, equality, inequality, monotonicity, unimodality, smoothness, etc. Includes flexible functions for solving MLS problems subject to user-specified equality and/or inequality constraints, as well as a wrapper function that implements 24 common constraint options. Also does k-fold or generalized cross-validation to tune constraint options for MLS problems. See ten Berge (1993, ISBN:9789066950832) for an overview of MLS problems, and see Goldfarb and Idnani (1983) <doi:10.1007/BF02591962> for a discussion of the underlying quadratic programming algorithm.

name: r-cmls
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.0-0' %}

package:
  name: r-cmls
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/CMLS_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/CMLS/CMLS_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 765f5d122fb37b93ac121bb41989af6b4260442bc55ac82fcb7a6a4335c68294

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  noarch: generic
  number: 1002
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-quadprog
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-quadprog

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('CMLS')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('CMLS')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=CMLS
  license: GPL (>= 2)
  summary: Solves multivariate least squares (MLS) problems subject to constraints on the coefficients,
    e.g., non-negativity, orthogonality, equality, inequality, monotonicity, unimodality,
    smoothness, etc. Includes flexible functions for solving MLS problems subject to
    user-specified equality and/or inequality constraints, as well as a wrapper function
    that implements 24 common constraint options. Also does k-fold or generalized cross-validation
    to tune constraint options for MLS problems. See ten Berge (1993, ISBN:9789066950832)
    for an overview of MLS problems, and see Goldfarb and Idnani (1983) <doi:10.1007/BF02591962>
    for a discussion of the underlying quadratic programming algorithm.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
    - PertuyF
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
